content.p:
Suppose we wish to maximize f(x_1, x_2, x_3) = {{objectivefunction}} subject to:
\begin{array}{rcl} {{row1}} & \leq & {{b1}} \\ {{row2}} & \leq & {{b2}} \\ {{row3}} & \leq & {{b3}} \\ x_1, x_2, x_3& \geq & 0 \\ x_1, x_2, x_3& \in & \mathbb{Z} \\ \end{array}
Use the cutting-plane algorithm to solve this integer optimization problem.

outtro.p: The optimal solution is found when x_1 = {{x1value}}, x_2 = {{x2value}}, and x_3 = {{x3value}}. The optimal objective value is f({{x1value}}, {{x2value}}, {{x3value}}) = {{optimalsolution}}
